notes.text: Updated Satellite 6.7 packages that fix several bugs are now available for Red Hat Satellite.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Satellite is a system management solution that allows organizations to configure and maintain their systems without the necessity to provide public Internet access to their servers or other client systems. It performs provisioning and configuration management of predefined standard operating environments.

This update fixes the following bugs:

1832581 Unable to list/enable EUS repositories on the RHEL clients registered in the satellite server with org_environment contentAccessMode
1839970 New version of the plugin is available: 1.0.7
1851128 Satellite 6.2 Upgrade Fails with error "rake aborted! NoMethodError: undefined method `first' for nil:NilClass" when there are custom bookmarks created
1851130 Satellite may create duplicate CreateRssNotifications tasks after restarting foreman tasks
1851132 candlepin refuses to start or hangs periodically when having too many messages in ActiveMQ journal
1851133 [RFE] Speed up the restore process
1851134 undefined method `split' for nil:NilClass when viewing the host info with hammer
1851136 Error while deleting the content view version.
1851137 While using concurrency_level in remote execution, job progress in WebUI is not being updated properly
1851138 Ldap refresh failed with "Validation failed: Adding would cause a cycle!"
1851140 "foreman-rake katello:publish_unpublished_repositories" is referring to column which no longer exists in katello_repositories table.
1851141 iso upload: correctly check if upload directory exists
1851148 Satellite Receptor Installer role can miss accounts under certain conditions
1851149 Changing a host parameter using "hammer host update" removes assigned Puppet classes
1851151 [RFE] Capsules shouldn't update hosts' "Registered through" facts on the Satellite server in a load-balanced configuration.
1851152 Capsule sync fails when promoting a content view to more than one lifecyle env at the same time
1851154 Unable to update default value of a smart class parameter (Sql query error).
1851157 Slow manifest import and/or refresh
1851158 Configure default MongoDB WiredTiger cache to be 20% of RAM in the Satellite server
1851159 Tasks uses wrong controller name for bookmarks
1851160 Get HTTP error when deploying the virt-who configure plugin
1851163 Improve performance of externalNodes
1854824 satellite-installer --enable-foreman-plugin-inventory-upload still attempts to install old inventory package
1856834 New version of the plugin is available: 1.0.9
1857359 large capsule syncs cause slow processing of dynflow tasks/steps

Users of Red Hat Satellite are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: FasterXML jackson-databind 2.x before 2.9.10.2 lacks certain net.sf.ehcache blocking.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jackson-databind: lacks certain net.sf.ehcache blocking
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: While OpenShift Container Platform's elasticsearch plugins do ship the vulnerable component, it doesn't do any of the unsafe things described in https://access.redhat.com/solutions/3279231. We may update the jackson-databind dependency in a future release.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For detailed instructions how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_satellite/6.7/html/upgrading_and_updating_red_hat_satellite/updating_satellite_server_capsule_server_and_content_hosts

The following conditions are needed for an exploit, we recommend avoiding all if possible:
* Deserialization from sources you do not control
* `enableDefaultTyping()`
* `@JsonTypeInfo using `id.CLASS` or `id.MINIMAL_CLASS`

notes.text: A flaw was found in FasterXML jackson-databind in versions 2.0.0 through 2.9.10.2. A "gadget" exploit is possible due to a lack of a Java object being blocking from being deserialized. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jackson-databind: Lacks certain xbean-reflect/JNDI blocking
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
Red Hat OpenStack Platform ships OpenDaylight, which contains the vulnerable jackson-databind. However, OpenDaylight does not expose jackson-databind in a way that would make it vulnerable, lowering the impact of the vulnerability for OpenDaylight. As such, Red Hat will not be providing a fix for OpenDaylight at this time.

While OpenShift Container Platform's elasticsearch plugins do ship the vulnerable component, it doesn't do any of the unsafe things described in https://access.redhat.com/solutions/3279231. We may update the jackson-databind dependency in a future release.

Red Hat Satellite 6 does not enable polymorphic deserialization which is a required configuration for the vulnerability to be used. We may update the jackson-databind dependency in a future release.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

notes.text: A flaw was found in jackson-databind 2.x in versions prior to 2.9.10.4. FasterXML jackson-databind 2.x mishandles the interaction between serialization gadgets and typing. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

notes.text: A flaw was found in jackson-databind 2.x prior to version 2.9.10.4.  The interaction between serialization gadgets and typing is mishandled in the bus-proxy. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jackson-databind: Serialization gadgets in org.aoju.bus.proxy.provider.*.RmiProvider
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
While OpenShift Container Platform's elasticsearch plugins do ship the vulnerable component, it doesn't do any of the unsafe things described in https://access.redhat.com/solutions/3279231. We may update the jackson-databind dependency in a future release.

Red Hat OpenStack Platform ships OpenDaylight, which contains the vulnerable jackson-databind. However, OpenDaylight does not expose jackson-databind in a way that would make it vulnerable, lowering the impact of the vulnerability for OpenDaylight. As such, Red Hat will not be providing a fix for OpenDaylight at this time.

Red Hat Satellite 6 does not enable polymorphic deserialization which is a required configuration for the vulnerability to be used. We may update the jackson-databind dependency in a future release.

The PKI module as shipped in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 does not enable polymorphic deserialization which is a required configuration for the vulnerability to be used, lowering the impact of the vulnerability for the Product. We may update the jackson-databind dependency in a future release.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: A flaw was found in jackson-databind 2.x in versions prior to 2.9.10.5. The interaction between serialization gadgets and typing is mishandled. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jackson-databind: serialization in oadd.org.apache.xalan.lib.sql.JNDIConnectionPool
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
While OpenShift Container Platform's elasticsearch plugins do ship the vulnerable component, it doesn't do any of the unsafe things described in https://access.redhat.com/solutions/3279231. We may update the jackson-databind dependency in a future release.

Red Hat OpenStack Platform ships OpenDaylight, which contains the vulnerable jackson-databind. However, OpenDaylight does not expose jackson-databind in a way that would make it vulnerable, lowering the impact of the vulnerability for OpenDaylight. As such, Red Hat will not be providing a fix for OpenDaylight at this time.

The PKI module as shipped in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 and Red Hat Satellite 6 does not enable polymorphic deserialization which is a required configuration for the vulnerability to be used, lowering the impact of the vulnerability for the Product. We may update the jackson-databind dependency in a future release.

The version of jackson-databind as shipped in Red Hat Software Collections rh-maven35 is used only while building maven, thus it does not deserialize data coming from untrusted sources, lowering the impact of the vulnerability for the Product.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For detailed instructions how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_satellite/6.7/html/upgrading_and_updating_red_hat_satellite/updating_satellite_server_capsule_server_and_content_hosts

The following conditions are needed for an exploit, we recommend avoiding all if possible:
* Deserialization from sources you do not control
* enableDefaultTyping()
* @JsonTypeInfo using id.CLASS or id.MINIMAL_CLASS
* oadd.org.apache.xalan.lib.sql.JNDIConnectionPool in classpath

notes.text: A flaw was found in jackson-databind 2.x in versions prior to 2.9.10.5. FasterXML jackson-databind 2.x mishandles the interaction between serialization gadgets and typing. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jackson-databind: serialization in weblogic/oracle-aqjms
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
While OpenShift Container Platform's elasticsearch plugins do ship the vulnerable component, it doesn't do any of the unsafe things described in https://access.redhat.com/solutions/3279231. We may update the jackson-databind dependency in a future release.

Red Hat OpenStack Platform ships OpenDaylight, which contains the vulnerable jackson-databind. However, OpenDaylight does not expose jackson-databind in a way that would make it vulnerable, lowering the impact of the vulnerability for OpenDaylight. As such, Red Hat will not be providing a fix for OpenDaylight at this time.

The PKI module as shipped in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 and Red Hat Satellite 6 does not enable polymorphic deserialization which is a required configuration for the vulnerability to be used, lowering the impact of the vulnerability for the Product. We may update the jackson-databind dependency in a future release.

The version of jackson-databind as shipped in Red Hat Software Collections rh-maven35 is used only while building maven, thus it does not deserialize data coming from untrusted sources, lowering the impact of the vulnerability for the Product.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For detailed instructions how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_satellite/6.7/html/upgrading_and_updating_red_hat_satellite/updating_satellite_server_capsule_server_and_content_hosts

The following conditions are needed for an exploit, we recommend avoiding all if possible:
* Deserialization from sources you do not control
* enableDefaultTyping()
* @JsonTypeInfo using id.CLASS or id.MINIMAL_CLASS
* oracle.jms.AQjms*ConnectionFactory in classpath
